column1: The Appellant also contended that the absence of thumb impression
or the signature of the 2nd  Accused  is  a clear indication that he was never
there  at  the  time  of  sealing  the  envelope  and  it  is  a  factor  which  is  in

support  of 
the  Appellant's  claim 
that  he  was  not  arrested  under 
the
circumstances that the prosecution claims. However, the Appellant himself

admits 
that  the  2nd  Accused  was  arrested  by 
the  PNB  Officers, 
thus

negating  any  significant 
impact 
that  could  result  from 
this 
lapse  by
